厚.definition: thick; deep or profound; kind; generous; rich or strong in flavor; to favor; to stress

厚古薄今.definition: to revere the past and neglect the present (idiom)

厚嘴啄花鳥.definition: (bird species of China) thick-billed flowerpecker (Dicaeum agile)

厚嘴綠鳩.definition: (bird species of China) thick-billed green pigeon (Treron curvirostra)

厚嘴葦鶯.definition: (bird species of China) thick-billed warbler (Arundinax aedon)

厚德載物.definition: with great virtue one can take charge of the world (idiom)

厚愛.definition: to show great affection and care

厚此薄彼.definition: to favour one and discriminate against the other

厚死薄生.definition: lit. to praise the dead and revile the living; fig. to live in the past (idiom)

厚生勞動省.definition: Ministry of Health, Labor and Welfare (Japan)

厚生相.definition: minister of health (of Japan, UK etc)

厚生省.definition: Ministry of Health and Welfare (Japan) (replaced in 2001 by 厚生勞動省|厚生劳动省[Hou4 sheng1 Lao2 dong4 sheng3])

厚積薄發.definition: lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom); good preparation is the key to success; to be well prepared

厚薄.definition: to favor one and discriminate against the other (abbr. for 厚此薄彼[hou4 ci3 bo2 bi3])

厚重.definition: thick; heavy; thickset (body); massive; generous; extravagant; profound; dignified

厚養薄葬.definition: generous care but a thrifty funeral; to look after one's parents generously, but not waste money on a lavish funeral
